channel.title: Tales of the valiant
channel.description:
Dramatic stories of great national heroes outside the English-speaking world.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Jose de San Martin
item.description: Jose de San Martin, hero of Argentina, crosses the Andes in the War of Liberation.
item.dc:creator: James, Julian
item.dc:subject: Argentina--History--War of Independence, 1810-1817--Drama.

item.title: Giuseppe Garibaldi
item.description: Giuseppe Garibaldi, hero of Italy, valiantly leads his Red Shirts to victory in Sicily.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: Italy--History, Military--19th century.

item.title: Audition sampler
item.description: This program features a sampling of episodes from the series for audition purposes.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: Qian, Gu, 1508-approximately 1578

item.title: Jose Rizel
item.description: Jose Rizal, hero of the Philippines, sets the theme of Philippine independence and is martyred by the Spaniards.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: Philippines--History--19th century.

item.title: El Cid
item.description: El Cid, hero of Spain, campaigns against the Moors and Spanish intrigue to prove his loyalty to the throne.
item.dc:creator: Willis, Edgar E.
item.dc:subject: Castile (Spain)

item.title: Kusunoki Masashige
item.description: Kusunoki Masashige, hero of Japan, prototype of loyalty and military skill, destroys the Hojo armies and sets the true Emperor upon the throne.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: Japan--History--14th century.

item.title: Saladin
item.description: Saladin, hero of Islam and the Arab states, throws the Frankish invaders from the Holy Land.
item.dc:creator: James, Julian
item.dc:subject: Crusades--13th-15th centuries--History.

item.title: Kemal Ataturk
item.description: Kemal Ataturk, hero of Turkey, establishes the Turkish Republic.
item.dc:creator: Willis, Edgar E.
item.dc:subject: Turkey--History--20th century.

item.title: Kou Ch'ien
item.description: Kou Ch'ien, hero of Free China, persevers over adversity and intrigue to reconquer the Kingdom of Yueh.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: China--History, Military.

item.title: Chevalier Bayard
item.description: Chevalier Bayard, hero of France, last Knight of the Middle Ages, leads the valiant defense of Mezieres.
item.dc:creator: Burrough, E.G.
item.dc:subject: Bayard, Pierre Terrail, seigneur de, approximately 1473-1524

item.title: Charles XII
item.description: Charles XII, hero of Sweden, attempts to dethrone the Tsar at Poltava.
item.dc:creator: Willis, Edgar E.
item.dc:subject: Sweden--History--Charles XII, 1697-1718

item.title: William of Orange
item.description: William of Orange, hero of Holland, leads the independence movement in the Low Countries.
item.dc:creator: Bender, William, Jr.
item.dc:subject: Netherlands--History--Eighty Years' War, 1568-1648.

item.title: Cuauhtemoc
item.description: Cuauhtemoc, hero of Mexico, last Lord of the Aztecs, defends Mexico City against Corte_s.
item.dc:creator: James, Julian
item.dc:subject: Corte_s, Herna_n, 1485-1547--Drama.

item.title: Darius the Great
item.description: Darius the Great, Emperor of ancient Persia and hero of Iran, wins over the Khan of the Bahktiari to forge the first world empire.
item.dc:creator: University of Michigan
item.dc:subject: Darius I, King of Persia, 548 B.C.-485 B.C.
